title: EU ESRS Update on Value-Chain Data Granularity
summary: The European Sustainability Reporting Standards (ESRS) update introduces enhanced requirements for value-chain data granularity. Companies must provide detailed supplier-level emissions data and category mappings to ensure alignment with CDP and CSRD frameworks.
what_might_change: Add supplier CSV fields and category mapping for CDP/CSRD alignment

title: US SEC Climate Disclosure: Assurance Phase-In Clarification
summary: The SEC has clarified the phase-in timeline for third-party assurance of climate disclosures. Large accelerated filers must obtain limited assurance starting in fiscal year 2026, with reasonable assurance required by 2028.
what_might_change: Add assurance evidence tracking and controls notes

title: UK ETS Expansion: Industrial Coverage & Free Allocation Changes
summary: The UK Emissions Trading Scheme proposes expanding coverage to additional industrial sectors while phasing out free allocation for certain high-emitting industries. The proposal includes transitional support mechanisms and enhanced monitoring requirements.
what_might_change: Model price scenarios and cost pass-through

title: California Methane LDAR Update
summary: California has updated its Leak Detection and Repair (LDAR) requirements for methane emissions. The new rules mandate more frequent monitoring intervals and require detailed methane-intensity reporting for oil and gas operations.
what_might_change: Increase monitoring cadence; add methane-intensity reporting fields

title: EU CBAM Reporting Phase
summary: The Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM) enters its reporting phase, requiring importers to declare embedded emissions in covered goods. Supplier declarations and detailed emissions calculations become mandatory for steel, cement, aluminum, fertilizers, and electricity.
what_might_change: Supplier declarations and embedded-emissions fields mandatory

title: US Federal Clean Energy Tax Credit Extension
summary: The Inflation Reduction Act tax credits for clean energy investments have been extended through 2035. Enhanced credits are available for projects meeting domestic content and prevailing wage requirements.
what_might_change: Track renewable energy investments and tax credit eligibility documentation

title: EU Corporate Sustainability Due Diligence Directive
summary: The CSDDD requires large companies to conduct human rights and environmental due diligence throughout their value chains. Companies must identify, prevent, mitigate, and account for adverse impacts, with civil liability for non-compliance.
what_might_change: Implement supplier risk assessment and remediation tracking systems

title: UK Mandatory Climate Transition Plans
summary: The UK proposes mandatory climate transition plans for listed companies and large private companies. Plans must include emissions reduction targets, decarbonization strategies, and governance structures aligned with net-zero commitments.
what_might_change: Develop transition plan framework and scenario analysis capabilities

title: California Cap-and-Trade Program Extension
summary: California has extended its cap-and-trade program through 2045 with declining emissions caps. The program includes updated offset protocols and enhanced linkage provisions with other jurisdictions.
what_might_change: Update allowance tracking and offset project eligibility assessments

title: US Federal Scope 3 Reporting Guidance
summary: The EPA proposes standardized guidance for Scope 3 emissions reporting across federal contractors. The guidance establishes calculation methodologies, data quality requirements, and reporting thresholds for 15 Scope 3 categories.
what_might_change: Implement Scope 3 calculation tools and supplier engagement protocols

title: EU Renewable Energy Directive Revision
summary: The revised Renewable Energy Directive increases the EU renewable energy target to 45% by 2030. Member states must implement support schemes and remove barriers to renewable energy deployment, with enhanced provisions for corporate renewable energy procurement.
what_might_change: Evaluate renewable energy procurement options and renewable energy certificate tracking

title: UK Plastic Packaging Tax Expansion
summary: The UK expands its plastic packaging tax to include additional packaging types and increases the tax rate. Companies must demonstrate that packaging contains at least 30% recycled content to avoid the tax, with enhanced record-keeping requirements.
what_might_change: Track packaging materials and recycled content documentation across supply chain
